docs.title: About
docs.text: I'm happy you want to know more about me.

docs.title: Hard facts
docs.text:
• based in Nuremberg
  • software developer @ Schaeffler by day
  • nerd by night

docs.title: In Use
docs.text:
• PiHole as ad-blocking DNS
  • Homematic IP with piVCCU
  • Homeassistant
  • Proxmox as host
  • Octoprint on Octopi
  • Paperless ngx for document storage
  • Portainer for managing all of these services

docs.title: Python
docs.text:
• pixi and uv for package management, inspired by Talk Python #439
  • streamlit and dash, bokeh for visualization of pandas or pola.rs dataframes, alternatively Shiny for Python
  • More Jupyter, for example Jupyter AI, JupyterCAD
  • Web development, using flask, SQLAlchemy, FastAPI, ..., potentially HTMX

docs.title: Embedded and Rust
docs.text:
• general embedded software development, starting with Raspi Pico
  • Using ferrocene compiler for safety critical applications
  • Mixing C and Rust
  • Implementing OSEK compliant OS
  • Embassy,
  • rattler, a conda alternative for crate management
  • Alternative Implementation of Taskjuggler in Rust for speedup

docs.title: Current projects
docs.text:
• Gardening: Growing all kind of vegetable and flowers, but also self-sustaining greenhouse, opensprinkler, managed garden water pump, building a hydroponic system, air quality sensor

  • Home Automation: with Homematic IP System for Shutters and Thermostats, but soon also Water Sensoring, Floor Heating Valves

  • Renovation

  • Sustainability

  • Task management system

  • arc42

  • Learning Rust

docs.title: Network Knowledge
docs.text:
• Search subnet for devices

    nmap -sn 192.168.1.0/24

  • Show ports and services opened at localhost

    nmap -v -sV localhost

if your internet provider is blocking ping reqs

    nmap -v -sV -Pn f<domain.url>

docs.title: From Jupyter Notebook to Github Pages
docs.text: If your Jupyter Notebooks should not starve somewhere in your workspace, you have to publish it without the need to execute the cells of the notebook. This blog post explains a simple workflow.

docs.title: How it works step-by-step
docs.text:
1. Create repo

Possibly from an jupyter notebook template

  1. Settings to use Github Pages

In Repo: Settings --> Pages --> Edit your branch and Deployment methods

  1. Dependency

in this example with uv uv add --dev ipykernel uv add --group deploy jupyter-book ghp-import

  1. Creation

with installation beforehand jb create notebook or without uv run --with jupyter-book jb create notebook Adapt your toc and config!

  1. Building: Jupyter-book

with installation beforehand jb build --path-output _build notebook/ or without uv run --with jupyter-book jb build notebook

  1. Deployment published with Github Pages script ghp-import

ghp-import -n -p -f _build/_build/html/

docs.title: Useful Links
docs.text: The workflow was adapted from this medium article

docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Nice to see you!

You're just reading my first post in the Lessons of the Day section

docs.title: I have even older lessons, for example bokeh
Getting Started
docs.text:
``` from bokeh.plotting import show, output_file, figure

x = [1,2,3,4,5] y = [3,8,3,3,5]

output_file('index.html')

p = figure( title='Simple Example', x_axis_label='X Axis', y_axis_label = 'X Axis' )

p.line(x,y, legend='Test', line_width=2)

show(p)
